definition: to regard as/to look upon as
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance

sentences.english: So, it's hard for me not to see this as being political.
sentences.chinese: 所以对我来说，很难不把这件事看做是一个政治事件。

sentences.english: Its light and resistant gear was taken as a novelty.
sentences.chinese: 它的轻便耐磨的齿轮被看做是一个传奇。

sentences.english: It would not be wrong to say that it is a kind of traditional art of behavior.
sentences.chinese: 把它看做一种传统的“行为艺术”，也未尝不可。

sentences.english: Today, many Burmese view China as a pillager of resources.
sentences.chinese: 如今，许多缅族人都把中国看做是一个资源掠夺者。

sentences.english: The hijacking of the Alabama is believed the first pirate attack on an American-flagged merchant ship in 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉巴马被看做200年来第一艘被劫的美国船只。

sentences.english: He looked upon his wife as the better half.
sentences.chinese: 他把妻子看做是贤内助。

sentences.english: Time to move forward, I also look forward to what?
sentences.chinese: 时间向前走，我还往后看做什么？

sentences.english: Considered an attack against democracy, the assassination caused the government to _declarewar on the yakuza.
sentences.chinese: 这被看做是对民主的攻击，政府正式对暴力团宣战。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, you are OK also these message regard as bru it or it is gossip.
sentences.chinese: 不过，你也可以将这些消息看做谣传或是道听途说。

sentences.english: The moon is the 'yin' or female principle and it is a trusted friend.
sentences.chinese: 月亮代表“阴”或女性，并且被看做是可靠的朋友。

sentences.english: I could have him for my fellow worker but not for a friend.
sentences.chinese: 我可以把他看做我的同事，却不能视作朋友。

sentences.english: The business world should start to see Twitter as one of the primary consumer communication channels available.
sentences.chinese: 企业应该开始将微薄看做一个基本的客户交流平台。

sentences.english: She is reckoned a very good teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她被看做是一位优秀教师。

sentences.english: Economic envy, once seen as a European vice, is now rife.
sentences.chinese: 曾经被看做欧式恶习的经济嫉妒，如今却很盛行。

sentences.english: Well, the people of Annam certainly don't view them as traditional.
sentences.chinese: 好吧，安南的人们当然不把他们看做传统的自己人。

sentences.english: He called the prison break a disaster.
sentences.chinese: 他把这次越狱事件看做一场灾难。

definition: to look upon as/to regard as
to regard as
to regard as/to treat as
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
to treat as/to regard as
to consider as/to take to be
to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
to be called/to be known as
in fact/in reality/as a matter of fact/in practice
to liken to/to compare to
certainty/without a doubt
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
in fact/in reality/actually/as a matter of fact/de facto/ipso facto
definition/to define
to believe/to think/to consider/to feel
to equate/equal to
